DataElement.preferredDefinition: Organizations that perform specific molecular analysis on caHUB biospecimens using defined platforms in which they are expert.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level._Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.:Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

Concepts.definition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.
